snippet: A mean-spirited and constitutionally suspect bill called the Child Interstate Abortion Notification Act is both an attack on women’s rights and on the basic principles of federalism.
abstract: Editorial scores the Child Interstate Abortion Notification Act introduced by House Republicans, contending that it is both an attack on women’s rights and on the basic principles of federalism; notes bill would impose a mandatory parental notification requirement and 24-hour waiting period on women under 18 who travel outside their home state to get the procedure.
lead_paragraph: A mean-spirited and constitutionally suspect bill called the Child Interstate Abortion Notification Act is both an attack on women’s rights and on the basic principles of federalism.
